list.name: Default Changelist
list.comment: Semantic statistical changes to ocelot.calculate functions. - Mean values are now only weighted with membership probabilities (*not* error values too) as correlations between errors and error values could cause weighted means to be biased. See: Pleiades controversy. - We now correctly infer both standard deviations and errors for all parameters (where appropriate), with error values weighted by sqrt(n_obs). HOWEVER, membership probabilities will mess up the standard error calculation, as there is no accepted way to calculate a weighted standard error on the mean. This would have to be done with a Monte Carlo method instead. See: https://stats.stackexchange.com/questions/25895/computing-standard-error-in-weighted-mean-estimation - So, for now, membership probabilities will be hard set to None. lol. waste of time xD

task.summary: Default task
Added a cluster_marker_radius parameter to ocelot.plot.clustering_result
Little fix to figure saving in ocelot.plot - we had the wrong method written (.save() instead of .savefig())

Work on ocelot.cluster preprocessing functionality. - Added ocelot.cluster.cut_dataset, which is able to make (clear comparative) cuts on Gaia-style data - Added ocelot.cluster.rescale_dataset, which wraps sklearn rescaling options and prevents nasty errors - Both of the above have unit tests and appear to be working well. This releases satisfies 0.3.0 feature a.

Work on ocelot.cluster nearest neighbor calculation. - Added precalculate_nn_distances to precalculate kth nearest neighbor distance matrices for algorithms like DBSCAN. - Still need to unit test this! This releases partially satisfies 0.3.0 feature b.

Work on ocelot.cluster nearest neighbor calculation. - Added a unit test for precalculate_nn_distances. - Added ACG+18 epsilon determination, complete with a unit test. This releases partially satisfies 0.3.0 feature b.

Work on ocelot.cluster nearest neighbor plotting. - Added ocelot.plot.nearest_neighbor_distance and various functions to contribute to it - Implemented unit tests for the above This releases partially satisfies 0.3.0 feature b.
Work on ocelot.cluster epsilon determination. - Began adding epsilon determination via model fitting & differentiation. This releases partially satisfies 0.3.0 feature b.

Work on ocelot.cluster epsilon determination. - Finished adding epsilon determination via model fitting & differentiation. - Added and verified unit tests for the above. This releases satisfies 0.3.0 feature b.
Work on ocelot.cluster epsilon determination. - Added a dpi parameter to ocelot.plot figures - Fixed a bug in acg epsilon determination This release fixes bugs in 0.3.0 feature b.
Work on ocelot.cluster epsilon determination. - Improved field model curve fit stability - Added a new epsilon c, epsilon f This release fixes bugs in 0.3.0 feature b.

Work on ocelot.calculate. - Implemented basic versions of .mean_distance, .mean_proper_motion, .internal_velocity_dispersion and .all_statistics - Radius and sky position stuff will need work - All the above is awaiting testing. This release partially satisfies 0.3.0 feature c.

Work on ocelot.calculate. - Implemented a basic version of .radius - Wrote unit tests for all functions in the submodule - Fixed a handful of small bugs in the implementations - Re-factored .all_statistics() so it can use different modes in the future. Eventually, it would be lovely to infer many of these parameters in a Bayesian way - All functions pass all tests =) This release satisfies 0.3.0 feature c.

Work on ocelot.crossmatch - Have now written a basic crossmatch utility in the form of a class with methods, ocelot.crossmatch.Catalogue - It should be able to crossmatch with an arbitrary number of features, depending on the catalogue to be matched against - It requires testing! This commit partially satisfies 0.3.0 feature d.

Work on ocelot.crossmatch - Basic bugfixing to ocelot.crossmatch.Catalogue (it now works as written and intended), but I'd like to refactor it to work in more sensible ways (e.g. using an estimated systematic error on position to calculate positional probabilities instead of using the tidal radius as a proxy.) - Next commit will be quite different! This commit partially satisfies 0.3.0 feature d.

Final work on ocelot.crossmatch to fix bugs and make it as usable as possible. - Added a systematic position error estimate parameter to the Catalogue class at __init__ - Changed Catalogue.crossmatch() to be much simpler to call and to now use ocelot standard parameter names, which are now stored in ocelot.calculate.constants - These parameter names can be overriden (or even added to!) with Catalogue.override_default_ocelot_parameter_names() - Increased the stats in the crossmatch process - now powered only by sigma values, ignoring tidal radii and looking for the mean or max sigma to pick a best match - Catalogue.crossmatch() is now unit tested (more of an integration test =p) after lots of checking values by hand and looking for bugs! This commit satisfies 0.3.0 feature d.

Final, final work on ocelot.crossmatch to fix bugs and make it as usable as possible. - Now using the ocelot standard parameter names in output match tables from Catalogue.crossmatch() for consistency, instead of using the column names of the literature catalogue. This commit satisfies 0.3.0 feature d.
Added a new metrics subpackage to ocelot.cluster. - Added a very basic (and probably hilariously slow) 5 parameter metric to cluster.epsilon. This commit is experimental work towards 0.3.0.

Small improvement to epsilon determination with the field model. - Now have a "model_minimum_drop" parameter that controls how low the model's epsilon values are able to go, helping to prevent floating point errors from taking logs extremely close to or beyond 0. This commit fixes bugs in 0.3.0 feature b.
Work on synthetic cluster generation. - Now have a simulated populations class - Lots of thinking and head scratching about how to do this best This commit is experimental work for 0.3.0

Work on synthetic cluster generation. - Now have a simulated populations class... that is nearly totally developed! - Added lots of methods to make the cluster based on a mass, then calculate parameters for member stars (like photometry, positions, proper motions...) - Still need the overall wrapper function to be made & also need a way to convolve Gaia errors onto our simulated stars! - Began writing a unit test for SimulatedPopulations. This commit is experimental work for 0.3.0

Work on synthetic cluster generation. - Now have most of SimulatedPopulations unit tested. - Going to make some changes to how radial profiles are drawn (the way I've done it has issues related to e.g. normal vs Rayleigh distributions.) This commit is experimental work for 0.3.0

Work on synthetic cluster generation. - Synthetic populations are now being correctly generated! The King profile was changed to be drawn from 3 times at once (i.e. in 3D.) - The class' runtime was sped up by a factor of ~15, by creating a sped up (check-free) version of the King profile, dramatically reducing the number of function calls by drawing a total number of points based on the expectation value of the accept/rejects, and by dropping stars below a conservative limiting magnitude very early in the process (making distant & large clusters much smaller.) This commit is experimental work for 0.3.0

Finishing touches to synthetic cluster generation. - Made a generate_synthetic_cluster() function that wraps the SimulatedPopulations class - Lots of default parameters now exist in synthetic.py. Might be worth making them neater somehow! - Did visual unit tests and it seems to be working! This commit is experimental work for 0.3.0

Improvements to ocelot.plot.clustering_result and bugfixes to synthetic cluster generation. - clustering_result now uses scatter plotting and supports transparency on cluster points (ideal for use with HDBSCAN soft clustering or other measures of membership probability.) - Various bugfixes in synthetic cluster generation (the unit testing wasn't really all that good ;) ) This commit is additional contributing work for 0.3.0.

Added resampling and covariance matrix handling. - Added a new sub-submodule, ocelot.cluster.resample - It can create correctly shaped astrometric covariance matrices from scratch given standard Gaia data - It can also re-draw points from said Gaia multivariate normal distributions, although it's not yet super efficient (that would require some Cython unfortunately.) This commit is additional contributing work for 0.3.0.

Small bugfixes and a new recenter_dataset preprocessing function. - Some little bugfixes done after starting using ocelot in anger - Added a new recenter_dataset function for centering fields on (0, 0) - Added (and then changed my mind about) some big changes to how plotting works. This could be improved upon at a later date. This commit is additional contributing work for 0.3.0.

Dataset partitioning and small documentation changes. - Now have a dataset partitioning class in the cluster.preprocessing submodule! It still requires unit testing. - Calculation of all_statistics now also adds the number of cluster member stars. This commit is additional contributing work for 0.3.0.

Small change to ACG epsilon determination with ocelot.cluster.epsilon.acg_18. - acg_18() now accepts list-like n_repeats as argument, and will calculate and return all of them - acg_18() now returns a pd.DataFrame of everything it found. The advantage of doing this with pandas is consistency when n_repeats is list-like - the number min_samples of each epsilon value is saved for future use. This commit is additional contributing work for 0.3.0.

Added HEALPix support to ocelot.cluster.recenter_dataset. - Can now specify pixel_id instead of the center of a field for HEALPix pixels - Can rotate the HEALPix pixel to have the edges of the boundary aligned with the latitude/longitude axes. - Passed its tests! This commit is additional contributing work for 0.3.0.

A little bit of extra ocelot.cluster.epsilon.acg_18 functionality. - The acg_18 epsilon determination function can now also output standard deviations of values. This commit is additional contributing work for 0.3.0.
Small bugfix to how acg epsilon determination works. - The nearest neighbor k is now correctly defined as min_samples - 1. This slightly reduces the estimates of this function.

Began re-working the DataPartition class to work with HEALPix for CAC20. - Split the existing class into a SquareDataPartition and a DataPartition superclass. - This can be developed further, though I'll leave the square one as-is for now because I'm not using it.
Field model bugfix. - Fixed a bug with epsilon field model determination in _summed_kth_nn_distribution_one_cluster: invalid parameters would cause a single np.inf to be incorrectly returned.
Bugfix for my bugfix...
Pushing a debug to the server, interim commit.

By debugging introduced a new bug! - _summed_kth_nn_distribution_one_cluster had unnecessary error checking. - Occasionally, for very extreme fit values (e.g. d_c=17!!) the cluster constant a_c can be higher than the field constant a_f. - This is not an issue because of how the fit is done in the modern form of field_model - values are constrained anyway during fitting, so the field cannot have a higher maximum than the cluster. But this isn't based on the constants, but instead the maxima - unlike the error checking in _summed_kth_nn_distribution_one_cluster, which was more basic and could fail in edge cases. - I removed the error checking as it wasn't helping!

Changed the DataPartitioner to work with HEALPix pixels. - Re-wrote much of the code to now use HEALPix. It is *not* backward compatible! - Made some efficiency improvements to how it calculates parallax members (more stuff is saved to the class for later use) - Unit tested and verified that the new changes work as intended. - Wrote some really neat plotting code for the unit testing that I should totally integrate into the class itself...

Final improvements to DataPartitioner. - Wrote some (untested!) code to test membership of cluster candidates within the core pixels and parallax range of a partition. - Made some improvements to how the bar chart plotting code works. Specifically, we now have some lovely diagnostic info on the largest cluster that could be detected within a cluster. - Integrated the neat code that plots individual partitions into the class itself. Previously, this was just a unit test diagnostic.

Little usability improvements to DataPartitioner. - Verbose printing output is now more informative. - Will now close all created partition plots to save on memory. (Albeit only if show figure is False!)
Little usability improvements to DataPartitioner II. - Now have lines to mark where values should be. - Saving shouldn't crop the figure anymore.
Little usability improvements to DataPartitioner III. - Small formatting changes on the bar chart plots.
Little usability improvements to DataPartitioner IV. - We now decrease the sub-partition HEALPix level until the number of stars in the partition is the same as some minimum_size.
Minor change to the way the test_if_in_current_partition works. It can now return de-centered ra and dec values too!

Dataset partitioning bugfixes. - Added error checking to DataPartition.test_if_in_current_partition() to ensure that get_partition() has been called at least once and that it hence has some internals to work with. - Fixed a bug in DataPartition.test_if_in_current_partition() that caused no stars to be compared against if the partition in question covers the entire field. - Greatly improved the unit testing of DataPartition.

Dataset partitioning can now produce distance-dependant numbers of components. - Re-factored to specify things in terms of a desired number of stars per component at each distance. - Added new diagnostics to the bar chart to show the difference between a plain GMM and one using "adaptive SPC". - Re-unit tested and it works like a charm!
Added attribute self.minimum_partition_size to the DatasetPartition class.
plot_partition_bar_chart now no longer requires self.data to be defined.

clip_to_fit_clusters in plot_clustering_result will now only clip to clusters the user has explicitly requested the plotting of, instead of clipping to all clusters with a non- -1 label in the labels.
Small bugfix to ocelot.crossmatch.Catalogue - line 268 used the wrong index, and was cycling over the index of all clusters being crossmatched against opposed to *only* clusters with a match.

MESSAGE.value: Added resampling and covariance matrix handling. - Added a new sub-submodule, ocelot.cluster.resample - It can create correctly shaped astrometric covariance matrices from scratch given standard Gaia data - It can also re-draw points from said Gaia multivariate normal distributions, although it's not yet super efficient (that would require some Cython unfortunately.) This commit is additional contributing work for 0.3.0.

Small bugfixes and a new recenter_dataset preprocessing function. - Some little bugfixes done after starting using ocelot in anger - Added a new recenter_dataset function for centering fields on (0, 0) - Added (and then changed my mind about) some big changes to how plotting works. This could be improved upon at a later date. This commit is additional contributing work for 0.3.0.

Dataset partitioning and small documentation changes. - Now have a dataset partitioning class in the cluster.preprocessing submodule! It still requires unit testing. - Calculation of all_statistics now also adds the number of cluster member stars. This commit is additional contributing work for 0.3.0.

Small change to ACG epsilon determination with ocelot.cluster.epsilon.acg_18. - acg_18() now accepts list-like n_repeats as argument, and will calculate and return all of them - acg_18() now returns a pd.DataFrame of everything it found. The advantage of doing this with pandas is consistency when n_repeats is list-like - the number min_samples of each epsilon value is saved for future use. This commit is additional contributing work for 0.3.0.

Added HEALPix support to ocelot.cluster.recenter_dataset. - Can now specify pixel_id instead of the center of a field for HEALPix pixels - Can rotate the HEALPix pixel to have the edges of the boundary aligned with the latitude/longitude axes. - Passed its tests! This commit is additional contributing work for 0.3.0.

A little bit of extra ocelot.cluster.epsilon.acg_18 functionality. - The acg_18 epsilon determination function can now also output standard deviations of values. This commit is additional contributing work for 0.3.0.
Small bugfix to how acg epsilon determination works. - The nearest neighbor k is now correctly defined as min_samples - 1. This slightly reduces the estimates of this function.

Began re-working the DataPartition class to work with HEALPix for CAC20. - Split the existing class into a SquareDataPartition and a DataPartition superclass. - This can be developed further, though I'll leave the square one as-is for now because I'm not using it.
Field model bugfix. - Fixed a bug with epsilon field model determination in _summed_kth_nn_distribution_one_cluster: invalid parameters would cause a single np.inf to be incorrectly returned.
Bugfix for my bugfix...

Specifically, we now have some lovely diagnostic info on the largest cluster that could be detected within a cluster. - Integrated the neat code that plots individual partitions into the class itself. Previously, this was just a unit test diagnostic.

Added attribute self.minimum_partition_size to the DatasetPartition class.
plot_partition_bar_chart now no longer requires self.data to be defined.

clip_to_fit_clusters in plot_clustering_result will now only clip to clusters the user has explicitly requested the plotting of, instead of clipping to all clusters with a non- -1 label in the labels.
Small bugfix to ocelot.crossmatch.Catalogue - line 268 used the wrong index, and was cycling over the index of all clusters being crossmatched against opposed to *only* clusters with a match.

option.name: LAST_COMMIT_MESSAGE
option.value: Small bugfix to ocelot.crossmatch.Catalogue - line 268 used the wrong index, and was cycling over the index of all clusters being crossmatched against opposed to *only* clusters with a match.
